sentences.english: It didn't even matter that it was cold and had no bathroom.
sentences.chinese: 房子里冷嗖嗖的，没有卫生间，不过这没什么。

sentences.english: The only sound you hear is your skis swishing through the snow.
sentences.chinese: 耳中只听见滑雪板滑过雪地的嗖嗖声。

sentences.english: It less of the nylon ' swish ' to it.
sentences.chinese: 它的音调比尼龙发出的“嗖嗖”声低。

sentences.english: If Su's madam a listen to Lin Mei, quick temper"Sou Sou" of the at heart soars.
sentences.chinese: 苏夫人一听林媚的话，心头的火气“嗖嗖”上涨。

sentences.english: Vaguely I remember the whooshing of air coming through vents in the walls.
sentences.chinese: 我依稀记得空气从车厢的墙上喷出来的嗖嗖声。

sentences.english: I especially like the wooshing sound they make as they go flying by.
sentences.chinese: 我尤其喜欢它们飞驰而过时发出的嗖嗖声。

sentences.english: The bullets sizzled over our heads.
sentences.chinese: 子弹在我们的头顶上嗖嗖飞过。

sentences.english: The ventilator whooshed as it pushed air into his lungs.
sentences.chinese: 呼吸器嗖嗖地把空气推进他的肺部。

sentences.english: He swished the tops off weeds with a sickle.
sentences.chinese: 他挥动镰刀嗖嗖地割掉了杂草的草尖。

definition: sound of the wind blowing or rain falling
(onom.) sound of the wind or the breathing of sb who is sound asleep
chilled to the bone/(of the wind) chilly
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
to whistle past/to hurtle past/to zip by
(onom.) scraping sound/ripping of fabric/screeching of tires
